intro: Tetranthera daradmeda, commonly known as the narrowleaf tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Tetranthera daradmeda is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
